correspAction.name: the Town Clerk, Borough of Portland

head.supplied: 29/3/93. ¶ Dear Sir ¶ ¶ Doubtless also in the Mechanics Inst. Library of Portland is a copy of my work on "Select plants for industrial culture"; in this book you will find also an account of the Coa...

div.p: To the Town Clerk, Borough of Portland
Borough of Portland inwards correspondence, Glenelg Shire, Portland, Vic.

The letter is date-stamped '12 APR. 93', indicating that it was 'received' at the meeting of the Borough Council on 12 April 1893. It was not mentioned on the business paper for the meeting but was probably treated as a supplement to an item listed among the inward correspondence, 'From Baron Von Mueller forwarding grass seeds' (letter not found); the newspaper report of the meeting referred to the item as 're fodder grasses' (Portland guardian, 14 April 1893, p. 3). 29/3/93.

Doubtless also in the Mechanics Inst. Library of Portland is a copy of my work on "Select plants for industrial culture"; in this book you will find also an account of the Coapim-Grass (Panicum spectabile).
B91.09.01, p. 321, or earlier editions. See also Town Clerk, Borough of Portland to M, 17 March 1893 (in this edition as 93-03-17a). This inexpensive and plain work is also purchasable for some few shillings at the Gov Printing Office of Melbourne.

div.p: Does any Lady or Gentleman collect Seaweeds occasionally at Portland-Bay?
